intro: Elleanthus ruizii, commonly known as the Ruiz's elleanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
